attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDEjbh1AhibVcVeWBTY_description
attribs.current: You can cast a druid spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDEo0ApvdXjgkX7fGkJ_description
attribs.current:
Over a period of several months you were subject to magical and mundane torture at the claws of Glaephang and his progeny. These experiments have left you horribly disfigured but mark you as a survivor of the Galephang Conclave. This affords you a measure of fame and notoriety, for those who know of your harrowing ordeal are keen to hear the tale personally but makes it difficult to disguise your appearance and hide from prying eyes.
You can parlay this attention into access to people and places you might not otherwise have, for you and your companions. Nobles, scholars, mages, and those who seek to ferret out the secrets of the Galephang Conclave would all be keen to hear your tale of survival, and learn what secrets (if any) you might possess, and/or study your affliction with great interest. However, you fear that your afflictions are not completely mundane and that the Galephang Conclave may as yet have some nefarious reason for allowing your escape, as your scars burn with frosty fury and seem to writhe beneath your skin at times. Note: This feature is a variant of the Far Traveler feature.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current:
Elongated, claw-like feet.

Anyone who refuses to celebrate my celebrity does not deserve my company.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I have faced the worst a dragon can deliver and survived. I am fearless, and my resolve unshakable.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Survivor. No matter the cost, I will take any action necessary to survive. (Any)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I have been reborn as a child of Galephang. I will claim my birthright as his chosen heir and successor

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDEssJHE2Fyyq7OphDT_description
attribs.current:
Breath Weapon. You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.
When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.

After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

Damage Resistance. You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LDEuauZxely0uCxAUnb_atk_desc

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDKX8LhBUWWzv3eNGYi_description
attribs.current:
Starting when you choose this circle at 2nd level, your beast shapes resemble dragons. You gain the ability to use Wild Shape on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action.
While transformed, your skin is covered in a layer of scales, and your AC is increased by 2.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LDSuVI9gFE-EgOyfNJz_atk_desc
attribs.current:
A 10-foot tall, 60-foot radius storm cloud cylinder appears 100 feet above you, with you as the center point. The spell fails if your location can't accommodate the cloud's size or height, or if you can't see 100 feet above you. When you cast the spell, choose a point in range from the cloud for lightning to strike. Each creature within 5 feet must make a Dexterity save, taking 3d10 lightning damage on a fail and half on a success. While the spell persists, you can use your action to call lightning to a point in range again.

If you're outdoors and in a storm, the spell gives you control of the storm rather than creating a new one. The lightning damage also increases by 1d10.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDsfYogOovuXDL0TKCg_description
attribs.current: Dexterity +1, Proficiency on saving throws using chosen ability.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LDsfq79iEA2DY8M-dr3_description
attribs.current:
You manifest scales and claws reminiscent of your draconic ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

Increase your Strength, Constitution or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Your scales harden. While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.
You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGn1wCSjmds2KlGVbp_description
attribs.current: Druids who join the Circle of the Wyrm hold dragons in highest regard, before all other works of creation. These druids believe, as many dragons do, that wyrms are perfect creatures, the pinnacle of all life brought into existence by the gods. Likewise, these druids aspire to perfect wyrmhood, and gradually become like dragonkind.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGn815amtBvxaFALXz_description
attribs.current: Starting at second level, you lose all of your spells. From here forward, every time you gain a spell level, its slots are fully invested into your Wyrmshape. You may Wyrmshape into any dragon who's CR matches the spell level of Wyrmshape charge you're expending, and is of the Chromatic or Metallic Subspecies that you've chosen. You may Wyrmshape as per Wildshape, save where Circle of the Wyrm specifies a difference.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGrCFw7E8YyQZEErIj_description
attribs.current: Starting at 6th Level,  your Wyrm attacks are magical for the purposes of rolling to hit, and against damage resistence. You may choose either a status effect, or elemental damage when transforming. Your melee attacks carry this attack type, Spellcaster DC is applied on a successful melee hit

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGrLGLfjZlR4Yj1-ue_description
attribs.current:
At 10th level, if you have more than 2 spell slots in a spell level, you may Wyrmshape to that level with the Wyrm's full health pool. This may be done once per relevant spell level. If a Dragon would have legendary resistence, you may use it 3 times per day.


Example: A Druid of level 10 with this ability would be able to shift into a Dragon of CR4 or lower and gain its full health pool. Or CR3 to CR2, or CR6 to CR2, ect.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGra9AxAMZWWWN4GZf_description
attribs.current:
At 14th Level, you've achieved your objective. You have at least attained, a True Wyrm Form. You are a Wyrmling of your Chromatic or Metallic Color, with Shapeshift(Birthform) as a bonus spell. You may Shapeshift into your Birthform anytime you could take an action or bonus action in place of that action or bonus action. Your birthform is considered a concentration spell, with a check required to prevent reverting to your true form when attacked. Your true form is that of the Wyrmling, and if knocked out of Wyrmshape, this form is the result. Your Wyrmling form takes the max hit die instead of the average for its health, which is 10d8+30 regardless of your Wyrmlings Natural Health.

Additionally, being a Legendary Creature you are now capable of Legendary Actions. Though, as per Timeless Body, each Action is representative of a spell slot "charge", and thus representative of the loss of a Wyrmshape. Spell slots are expended from highest level slot to lowest level slot available.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LEGrprJZSHBzloprfJh_description
attribs.current:
At 14th level, You may chose to expend spell slots equal to the CR difference between your current Wyrmshape form and another higher CR form in order to Wyrmshape into a more advanced form of Wyrm. These spell slots are taken from lowest level to highest level when transforming in this manner. Doing so requires 1 action, though any number of spell slots may be consumed in that action.

Prior to level 18, but after 14th level, the 'Timeless Body' that is the Wyrmform itself counts towards casting 1st and 2nd level charges of timeless magic. (Meaning Shifted Dragon forms, not your Wyrmling Primary Body.) Wyrmforms are considered the mean age of their category for purposes of aging.

You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.
